item.title: Fourth Sonic the Hedgehog film announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/fourth-sonic-the-hedgehog-film-announced

Plot details to be announced.

A fourth Sonic the Hedgehog theatrical film is currently in development with an anticipated release of spring 2027, SEGA and Paramount announced.

The third movie, Sonic the Hedgehog 3, will premiere in theaters on December 20, and currently has an 86 percent fresh score on Rotten Tomatoes based on 57 critic reviews.

Plot details about Sonic the Hedgehog 4 are still to be announced.

Thanks, Variety.

item.title: To the Moon: Sigmund Minisodes 1 and 2 now available for PS5, coming to Xbox Series and Switch in early 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/to-the-moon-sigmund-minisodes-1-and-2-now-available-for-ps5-coming-to-xbox-series-and-switch-in-early-2025

  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Priced at $2.99 and $1.99, respectively.

Publisher Serenity Forge and developer Freebird Games have released To the Moon: Sigmund Minisode 1 (Holiday Special) and To the Moon: Sigmund Minisode 2 (Holiday Special) for PlayStation 5 for $2.99 and $1.99, respectively. Xbox Series and Switch versions will follow in early 2025.

Both games were originally released as free downloadable content for the PC version of To the Moon. However, on consoles they are each paid, standalone experiences.

Here is an overview of each episode, via Serenity Forge:

To the Moon: Sigmund Minisode 1 (Holiday Special)

Return to the world of To the Moon in this heartfelt spin-off that dives deeper into the lives of Dr. Eva Rosalene and Dr. Neil Watts. During a holiday season filled with both festive cheer and public protests against the Sigmund Corporation, this minisode explores the ethical dilemmas and emotional challenges behind their wish-fulfillment work.

To the Moon: Sigmund Minisode 2 (Holiday Special)

Step into the next chapter of To the Moon with Sigmund Minisode 2, a poignant holiday-themed spin-off that offers a deeper look at the lives of Dr. Eva Rosalene and Dr. Neil Watts. This part continues to explore the personal struggles, mysterious secrets, and ethical dilemmas faced by the doctors of Sigmund Corporation.

Watch a new trailer below.

Consoles Trailer
